title: Bruce Springsteen - 1981-05-07 Follow That Dream Revisited (live
description:
Bruce Springsteen - 1981-05-07, Isstadion, Stockholm SE - Follow That Dream Revisted 


EXC AUD - Sample & behold - Download txt file entitled "Samples off my Soundcloud," url's to 5 full-song from quiet to loud samples


Bruce Springsteen and The E Street Band - European Leg of The River Tour (1981 - 04-07 - 06-08)

Follow That Dream Revisited (2002) : Recorder 1, Remastered version.

Files in same form as found in 2009 (from I don't remember).

Vivid River Ride By Night...

Notes:

- Remastered from the vinyl bruceleg.
- On disc 1 "Darkness On The Edge Of Town" and "Independence Day" are indexed as 1 track, whilst the artwork states, that
  they are indixed seperately. This of course decreases the numbers of actual tracks on disc one with one track.
- Disc 3 Track 2 [302] includes 'High School Confidential"
- Disc 3 Track 4-8 [34 - 308] Scandinavium, Gothenburg, Sweden 1981-05-03


Enjoy The Show,

Jeff

____________________________________________________________________________


- 5-7-81 Storyteller : Compiled by : Johanna PirttijÃƒÂ¤rvi c/o Brucebase incl.



"Are you ready for the Ten?...In the Midnight Hour!"


2014-05-07 thewaymouth aka mikedreams on...The Pirate Bay


- Known flaw (from Recorder 1) : Track 109 The Promised Land - At 5:11 splice (mid - harmonica solo, at end = about 25 sec missing)


- Per Brucebase, Track 111, The River has a notable edit in it. But I don't hear one at all - check sample.

But then BB says there are "fairly regular crackles" on the Recorder 1/vinyl source. 

I don't hear them here either. 

...Maybe I am going deaf.

[ -- "You didn't have to live and die like my old man did, working in some factory till he couldn't hear what you were saying to him anymore." 

 -- Point taken, Bruce. My father just chose to live and die without ever hearing me. Besides it was 16 Tons of live Clash that enflamed my eardrums till I was on fire forever.]


- "Follow That Dream Revisited" is reported to be remastered in 2002 from a previously unplayed vinyl copy of the bootleg, Follow That Dream. 

The Recorder 1 mastertapes were destroyed during a fire in the mid-80's. (See info in booklet included.)


[Back in the daze my ex-wife made me sell my dream lp copy along with lots of other vinyl boots like roses in the rain. ...Fuck me... She wouldn't.]
 

- Besides being a simply amazing performance by the man and the band, this source is by far the best-sounding River show I know, that I believe more than any other gets the job done. 


Seven Days In May - MAY 7 - HAPPY FESTA OF ST. NICOLA!

...in Bari, Italy, celebrates the transfer of his relics to Bari. Religious rites followed by spectacular fireworks displays, honor this patron of orphans, pirates, etc.


 -- "The only thing when I was young that kept me from giving up, was that in the rock and roll music that I heard, there was promise that there was a meaning in life, a meaning in living." 

 -- Revisit Follow That Dream Revisited.

"It's like the whole world's walking pretty."
